bibl.title: Letter from William C. Gorgas to George E. Bushnell, May 3, 1906

div1.p: Gorgas informs Bushnell that his medical staff is full at present, but that he will consider adding physician Alexander Murray if there is an increase in staffing.

div1.head: Letter from William C. Gorgas to George E. Bushnell, May 3, 1906
div1.opener:
Appl
file
915
May 3, 1906.
Maj. George E. Bushnell, U.S.A.,
Fort Bayard, New Mexico.
My dear Major Bushnell:-
div1.p:
Yours of April 16th received. Our
medical staff is full at present and we have about all the
Service men we can use. I will bear the matter in mind
however, in case our staff should be increased. The detail
would have to be made by an application from me to the
Commission and the Commission would make the request upon
the War Department.

Dr. Murray's case is indeed a sad one and I
would be glad to do what I could to make it easier for him.
A great deal may happen between now and 1907.

I hope that you are again all right in point of
health.
With kindest regards and best wishes, I remain,
div1.closer: Yours very sincerely, W. C. Gorgas FILE
